thread.title: Benedict Cumberbatch jokes he can't do North East accent 'without surgery' as he stars in Brexit movie

author: Jack Elsom
title: Benedict Cumberbatch jokes he can't do North East accent 'without surgery' as he stars in Brexit movie
text:
News Benedict Cumberbatch jokes he can't do North East accent 'without surgery' as he stars in Brexit movie The actor has recently filmed a movie about Brexit where he plays Vote Leave campaign chief Dominic Cummings from Durham Share Benedict Cumberbatch starring as Dominic Cummings in Brexit movie (Image: HBO)
Benedict Cumberbatch has joked that he could not do a North East accent without undergoing surgery after he played a Durham strategist in an upcoming movie about Brexit .
The 42-year-old Sherlock actor will star as the 'Vote Leave' campaign director, Dominic Cummings, in an HBO film for Channel 4 about the 2016 referendum.
Cummings was born in Durham and attended Durham School before becoming an advisor to Michael Gove and leading the Leave campaign two years ago. Benedict Cumberbatch will star as Durham's Dominic Cumberbatch in Brexit movie (Image: PA)
The 47-year-old election guru is married to Mary Wakefield, deputy editor of the Spectator and daughter of Northumberland 's Sir Humphrey Wakefield, who revealed that Cumberbatch had struggled with her husband's accent.
In her Spectator column she wrote that Cumberbatch had said: "That soft 'R'. I don't know if it's Durham or something specific to Dom. Read More 13 new laws and rules coming into force in 2019 and how they will affect you
"He's got a different shape jaw to me, so the accent wasn't easy... It would be very hard for me to maintain that accent without some sort of surgery, and I don't think Iâ€™d go that far!"
The movie 'Brexit' will premiere on Channel 4 on January 19 and focuses on how Cummings, who is dubbed 'the man behind Brexit', used advanced electioneering tactics to persuade the nation to vote to leave the European Union. Campaign Director of Vote Leave, Dominic Cummings (Image: parliamentlive.tv)
A newly released trailer begins with Cumberbatch staring at the camera saying "everyone knows who won, but not everyone knows how."
The two-minute clip also shows the actor standing in front of the controversial Brexit bus while jumping up and down yelling "let's take back control!" while an actor playing Boris Johnson watches. Read More
